posts.post_content:
Why is everyone talking about 4-ofs when this is restricted. Yeah if you play 4 in casual, that's neat, but at the same time don't you feel dirty? What's the difference at that point than putting 6 in your deck?  
  
At any rate, a great card. A lot of people on here seem to not understand it's actual power (by the combos) or to understand 4-of-these is gitlike.   
  
My turn 1 combo?  
[Chancellor of the Forge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chancellor of the Forge)  
[Blazing Shoal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blazing Shoal)  
[Sol Ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sol Ring)  
[Mountain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mountain)  
[Assault Strobe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Assault Strobe)  
[Adventuring Gear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Adventuring Gear) OR [Bonesplitter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bonesplitter)  
[Lotus Petal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Petal)  
  
Turn 0 - Reveal Chancellor  
Turn 1 going first  
Lotus Petal, sac for 1 mana  
use mana for Sol Ring, tap for 2 mana  
use mana play adventuring gear or bonesplitter   
use remaining mana to attach to token  
play mountain, tap for red  
use red on assault strobe  
attack with token  
blazing shoal on token removing the chancellor (for +7)  
  
swing fo... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
@Youlose20life:
  
   
First of, "mexican" is not a language. They speak spanish in mexico. Second, "sol" is a latin word. It means sun. This is why a lot of words pertaining to the sun have that prefix. For example, "solar".
